title: Proactive role of road infastuctures in the overall transport system for safety

Good morning ladies and gentlemen and thank you for attending this session.

It helps by identifying any potential safety deficiency and makes recommendations to changes in the design.

The launch of this program will take place in Brussels by the end of June.

Driver friendly.

And as far as possible, creating forgiving Rd a Rd which is capable to up to a certain point up to a certain level.
Forgive the mistakes made by the driver.

You've got the driver, young and experienced, and driving fast.

Anne.

Try to avoid accidents by acting on the driver level.

Features, but the driving mistakes will remain in effect of light because, as I said previously, humans are humans.

There is a protective barrier.
Well, it seems OK.
But in fact, the protection should have been longer all along the road.
And there's a big risk for the vehicle to get over behind.
The protection behind the buyer and getting collision with the pillar.

Environment what is, for example, the common single vehicle collision configuration?
What is the effectiveness of passive safety devices?
What Rd geometric and surface characteristics are likely to trigger accident?
These are sort of questions that should be addressed.
Do European research programs can assist network managers in anticipating Rd accidents and giving priorities to their actions towards increasing safety?
Now, last part of this presentation.
What is the role of the erfa into this global frame?

Participates also in the publication of different documents, newsletters, discussion papers, public.
